question_sentence: Prosecutors in Marine Le Pen's embezzlement trial have said the French politician should be banned from running for office for how long if found guilty?
evidence: A ban on running for office would scupper Le Pen's dream of a fourth – and this time likely successful – run at the French presidency in 2027. She has denied misusing EU funds for party work, and has claimed the charges against her and other members of her far-right National Rally party are politically motivated.

question_sentence: Which US historical figure was awarded the rank of brigadier general in the Maryland National Guard?
evidence: Abolitionist Harriet Tubman, who escaped slavery in 1849 and led over 70 enslaved Black people to freedom, was posthumously awarded the rank of brigadier general in the Maryland National Guard, 161 years after she became the first woman to oversee an American military action during a time of war.

question_sentence: The prime minister of which Caribbean country was unceremoniously ousted by its transitional ruling council?
evidence: Garry Conille was dismissed by the cross-party committee currently filling the role of president, which has been vacant since the assassination of Jovenel Moïse in 2021. Conille, appointed by the council in June, said in an open letter that his removal was "outside any legal and constitutional framework".

question_sentence: Yale University is getting a new course dedicated to which pop star?
evidence: A new course focused on Queen B will be on the syllabus this upcoming spring semester at the Ivy League university. The class, titled "Beyoncé Makes History: Black Radical Tradition History, Culture, Theory & Politics Through Music", will use her work as a lens through which to "examine Black intellectual thought and activism".

question_sentence: Premier League referee David Coote has been suspended over a video in which he could be heard insulting which manager?
evidence: Coote has been suspended over the derogatory comments about Liverpool and the club's former manager. One of the alleged comments refers to the German coach's nationality, which could also land Coote in hot water with the Football Association.

question_sentence: A US Air National Guard member has been sentenced to 15 years in prison for what?
evidence: Jack Teixeira was sentenced to 15 years for leaking classified defence information on Discord, containing secret information on how the US transported military equipment to Ukraine and how it would be used. He posted sensitive details nearly every day for more than a year.

question_sentence: A search has been launched to find a woman who infiltrated what formerly all-male society by posing as a teenage boy?
evidence: Sophie Lloyd duped her way into the then all-male magicians' society in 1990 by disguising herself as a teenage boy named Raymond. She was expelled 18 months later when she revealed her true identity after the club voted to accept female magicians. Despite the rule change, she was kicked out for using "deliberate deception".

question_sentence: King Charles attended the world premiere of which movie, after meeting some of the cast at a reception at Buckingham Palace?
evidence: The evening before the King's 76th birthday saw him walk the red carpet in Leicester Square for the world premiere of Ridley Scott's action-packed sequel to his 2000 swords and sandals blockbuster.

question_sentence: Which X rival has acquired more than one million new users since the US election?
evidence: The exodus of users from X appears to be motivated by changes to blocking and a flood of "misinformation and offensive posts" on the platform, said The Guardian, as well as more general concerns over owner Elon Musk's role in the forthcoming Trump administration.

question_sentence: Who did Donald Trump name as his pick for United Nations ambassador?
evidence: Donald Trump named Republican representative Elise Stefanik as his United Nations ambassador pick. Trump's early appointments highlight his focus on favouring loyalists who support his policies, especially on foreign and immigration issues.

question_sentence: Why was the voyage of the historic SS United States delayed?
Which organization is WSFS Bank collaborating with for the holiday food drive?
Which Delaware high school has won the most boys soccer state titles?
Which Delaware city is said to have some of the kindest residents in the US?
What is the century-old creamy beef breakfast dish that fed US military soldiers?
Why did Mattel apologize regarding the 'Wicked' doll packaging?
What was one of the key initiatives in Wilmington Mayor Mike Purzycki's agenda?
What is the focus of the new Southbridge Community Services Building in Wilmington?
choices: Offering affordable housing for homeless veterans

question_sentence: How much did Sierra Wright spend on chips in 'Survivor' Season 47?
Which college will Sanford's Jayden Taylor play basketball for?
Who did President Joe Biden meet with at the White House this week?
evidence: President Joe Biden met with President-elect Donald Trump and said that he looks forward to a “smooth transition” in January, adding he will “make sure” his predecessor and successor is accommodated as he retakes the White House.

question_sentence: Which item was recently removed from school menus across the United States?
evidence: Lunchables have been removed from the National School Lunch Program, months after Consumer Reports said sodium levels in the meal kits were too high.

question_sentence: Tropical storm activity should be winding down in November but a dangerous system formed in the Caribbean this week. What is its name?
evidence: Sara is the 18th named storm of the 2024 Atlantic hurricane season. Parts of Central America are expecting “life-threatening” flooding in the coming days, the National Hurricane Center warned.

question_sentence: The FAA has temporarily grounded all US flights to which country?
evidence: The FAA has grounded all flights to Haiti after three jets from US-based airlines were struck by bullets while flying over the country’s capital, Port-au-Prince.

question_sentence: Which Republican lawmaker will succeed Mitch McConnell as the next Senate majority leader?
choices: Sen. John Thune of South Dakota
evidence: Sen. John Thune won the Senate leadership race to become the first new GOP leader in 18 years. Thune will officially become majority leader when the new Senate is sworn in on January 3.

question_sentence: A huge crime network forging Banksy, Warhol and Picasso artworks was uncovered in which country?
evidence: More than 2,000 fake artworks were seized by Italian police following a monthslong investigation. Authorities said the fake art had a potential market value of about $215 million.

question_sentence: Firefighters battled dangerous wildfires on the East and West coasts this week. What's the name of the deadly blaze located near the New York-New Jersey border?
evidence: Firefighters worked to contain the Jennings Creek Fire that prompted evacuations and charred dozens of structures. Meanwhile, the Mountain Fire in California’s Ventura County quickly spread this week as strong winds continue in the region.

question_sentence: Which country is reeling from a mass hit-and-run incident?
evidence: A driver recently plowed a car into crowds at a sports center in China, killing at least 35 people. It is the country’s deadliest known attack in a decade.

question_sentence: Which state is in a legal battle over a Ten Commandments law?
evidence: A federal judge has temporarily blocked a Louisiana law requiring the Ten Commandments to be displayed in every public school classroom by 2025.

question_sentence: Which federal holiday was commemorated in the US this week?
evidence: Millions across the US commemorated Veterans Day on November 11, a federal holiday honoring active and former US service members.
